newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan, U.S. to meet Aug 5 on NTT's procurement.
newsitem.headline: Japan, U.S. to meet Aug 5 on NTT's procurement.

text.p: Japanese and U.S. government officials will meet in San Francisco on August 5 to review Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp's (NTT) international procurement for the year ended March 1997, a Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications official told reporters on Thursday.

But the official reiterated Tokyo's stance that it would not discuss a renewal of the Japan-U.S. pact on NTT's procurement unless Washington grants NTT an international telecoms licence in the United States.
"We will not sit at the discussion table (on the renewal of the pact) unless Washington promptly grants NTT an international licence," the official said.
In the August meeting, Japan and the United States will discuss how NTT's international procurement is progressing, the official said.
Japan and the United States meet annually to review NTT's international procurement, which amounted to 173 billion yen in 1996/97, up from 152 billion yen in the previous year.
The Japan-U.S. pact on NTT's international procurement was first signed in 1981 and will expire at the end of September.
